text:
Senator: "Who's winning the AI race?"

Sam Altman: "It’s very hard to say how ahead we are from China, but I’d say... not a huge amount of time."

China is winning because:

☑ State-led funding at scale, pumping tens of billions into AI R&D
☑ End-to-end supply chain control from chip design (Huawei, SMIC) to fabrication
☑ Vast domestic data sets and lax privacy rules for model training
☑ Rapid deployment from startups like DeepSeek with cut-price models
☑ Talent repatriation incentives drawing top researchers back to Beijing

In a matter of 12 months, China…
→ Rolled out the 910C GPU across government labs
→ Launched DeepSeek R2 at 1/4th Western prices
→ Spent $50 billion on AI compute infrastructure
→ Built 2,000 AI-optimized data centers
→ Graduated 100,000 new AI PhDs

U.S. is winning because:

☑ Private-sector innovation from OpenAI, Google, Anthropic
☑ GPU and cloud leadership via NVIDIA, AWS, Azure
☑ Deep venture-capital ecosystem fueling rapid startup growth
☑ Open research culture accelerating breakthroughs and publications
☑ Strategic export controls limiting China’s access to cutting-edge chips

In a matter of 12 months, the U.S.…
→ Raised $30 billion in AI venture funding
→ Passed light-touch AI bills for innovation
→ Deployed “Stargate” compute hubs nationwide
→ Attracted 50,000 AI researchers with new visas
→ Launched GPT-4.5 and Gemini 2.5 to global users

The AI race is tight.
